They went camping each summer for Laura's birthday, which was June 19, but things were different this year, arguably the most important. The boys were going in different directions. They'd kissed and hadn't talked about it. He was in part the reason for it, but Levi had been understanding. It was Ethan they were worried about. He wasn't the most mature when it came to things he couldn't control. Don was planning not to go, but as he lay in bed on the eve of their tradition, he knew what was right. 

"Dad, no offense but this is ridiculous," Levi had said. "You're both acting like high schoolers."
